subject: p12475198
History: Evaluation of the patient with coronary artery disease, congestive heart failure, and hypoxemia.
Findings: Portable AP radiograph of the chest was reviewed in comparison to. Since the prior study, there is no change in extremely irregular opacification of both lungs, mostly involving the right lung with slight interval improvement in particular in the right mid lung. This improvement, which is rapid, most likely reflects the element of pulmonary edema. Pneumonia improvement over such a short period of time would be less likely, although still possible .
